thread.title: Cockroach Moshing Is Now A Thing, Here's What It Looks Like [News]
thread.title_full: Cockroach Moshing Is Now A Thing, Here's What It Looks Like [News]

title: Cockroach Moshing Is Now A Thing, Here's What It Looks Like [News]
text:
Cockroach Moshing Is Now a Thing, Here's What It Looks Like In Japan, of course... UG News editor since early 2013. King Crimson fan. I handle the news around here. Posted 11 hours ago 5 
A Japanese grindcore band called Viscera Infest pioneered a brand new moshing style, branding it "cockroach moshing." 
No further intro needed, you can check it all out below. 15 hours ago in Music news , 10 comments 3 20 hours ago in Community Feed , 2 comments 8 4 days ago in Music news , 46 comments Trending stories 8 hours ago in Features , 23 comments 34 14 hours ago in Music news , 16 comments 21 24 comments sorted by best / new / date B I thought the "cockroach" at a mosh pit was when you hid your weed in your underpants 3 its like people trying to do the gator and having a seizure instead 3 Looks like baby tantrum. Oh japan.. we love you guys for all your weirdness 10 Well, not Japan, but Korea. Still the best commercial ever made 6 You're right. It's even in the description. My bad 1 So weird and cringeworthy,the Japanese push the envelope quite well. 4 They should come try that at a real venue so they can get stuck to the floor like a real cockroach trap. 2 Now you can step on the roaches and call it 'Roach Surfing' instead of Crowd Surfing. 1 Its nothing new.Punks were doing the same thing forty (yeah,forty)years ago.It was called "The dying fly" which is uncannily similar in its entymological theme!! 1 silent caution Â· 11 hours ago What the... o.O Really? I guess, no more internet for me today. 0 Forget six minute abs, I just found my new workout. 0 If this was done in the states, I would of been utterly confused. But Japan, not surprised at all. Found it quite funny. Also thought it was cool that the drummer convinced Lars to give him his St. Anger snare. 0 I thought it was an actual cockroach moshing 0 Well, I guess the cockroach moshing was killed because the video is no longer available. 0
